title: Create a Better Coffee Mug (Refined)
description: Model a more ergonomic, print-friendly mug using revolve + shell, a comfortable rim, and a stronger handle sweep with better blending.

steps.title: Start Mug Body Sketch (Outer Profile)
steps.instruction: Create a new sketch on the XZ plane. We’ll sketch ONLY the mug’s outer silhouette (no inner wall yet).
steps.detailedText: A cleaner workflow is: revolve a solid outer body first, then use Shell to hollow it. This avoids profile mistakes and makes the wall thickness editable later.

expandedContent.whyThisMatters: Revolve + Shell is robust and easy to adjust for printability and comfort.
tips: Use the XZ plane so you can revolve around the Y-axis.
Keep the outer profile smooth and slightly tapered for better looks and easier printing.

qcChecks.text: You are in sketch editing mode

warnings.text: Avoid sketching on XY by accident; the revolve axis workflow expects XZ.

steps.title: Sketch Outer Silhouette (Taper + Base)
steps.instruction: Use Line + Arc to sketch the outer profile: ~95mm tall, base radius ~34mm, rim radius ~38mm (slight outward flare), with a small base foot detail.
steps.detailedText: A slight taper and rim flare looks more like a real mug and feels better in-hand. Adding a base foot improves stability and visual quality.

expandedContent.whyThisMatters: Taper improves ergonomics, aesthetics, and print success (less abrupt geometry).
tips: Dimension your height and radii early to lock proportions.
Use a small arc or fillet in-sketch to avoid sharp corners at the base transition.

qcChecks.text: Outer profile has a vertical height dimension (~95mm)
Outer profile includes base radius + rim radius dimensions

warnings.text: Keep the entire profile on the RIGHT side of the revolve axis.

steps.title: Close Profile + Finish Sketch
steps.instruction: Close the silhouette back to the revolve axis and click Finish Sketch.
steps.detailedText: Fusion needs a closed profile region for Revolve. Finishing the sketch locks geometry for the 3D feature.

tips: You should see a shaded region when the profile is closed.
If it doesn’t shade, look for tiny gaps or overlapping lines.

steps.title: Revolve Outer Body (New Body)
steps.instruction: Create > Revolve. Select the closed profile and revolve 360° around the Y-axis. Operation: New Body.
steps.detailedText: This creates the solid outer mug shape. We’ll hollow it next with Shell for clean, editable wall thickness.

requires.reason: Revolve is a Solid environment tool.

qcChecks.text: A new solid body appears in the browser/timeline

warnings.text: If revolve fails, check the profile doesn’t cross the axis and is fully closed.

steps.title: Shell the Mug (Hollow the Body)
steps.instruction: Modify > Shell. Select the TOP face (opening) and set thickness to 3mm.
steps.detailedText: Shell hollows the body with consistent thickness. 3mm is a common safe thickness for 3D printing and still feels realistic.

requires.reason: Shell is a Solid environment Modify tool.

tips: Make sure you select the top opening face, not the side surface.
If shell fails, reduce thickness or simplify geometry near the base.

warnings.text: If the base is too complex, Shell may fail—try removing the base foot detail or lowering thickness.

steps.title: Comfortable Rim (Fillet Inner + Outer Lip)
steps.instruction: Modify > Fillet. Select the top inner edge and top outer edge. Set radius to 1.5–2mm.
steps.detailedText: A softened rim feels better and looks more premium. Doing inner + outer edges prevents a sharp ‘knife edge’.

requires.reason: Fillet is a Solid Modify tool.

tips: Hold Ctrl to select multiple edges.
If fillet fails, try 1mm first, then increase.

steps.title: Handle Path Sketch (Better Ergonomics)
steps.instruction: Create a sketch on the XZ plane. Use 3-Point Arc to draw a handle path: start ~18mm below rim, end ~25mm above base, arc outward ~28–32mm.
steps.detailedText: A larger outward arc gives better knuckle clearance and looks more proportionate with the flared rim mug.

tips: Aim for a smooth ‘C’ shape with enough clearance for 2–3 fingers.
Keep endpoints close enough to the mug surface so the sweep can join cleanly.

warnings.text: Don’t let the arc intersect the mug body—keep it outside.

steps.title: Handle Profile Sketch (Oval / Rounded Rectangle)
steps.instruction: Finish the path sketch. Create a new sketch on a plane perpendicular to the path start. Draw an 11mm x 8mm rounded rectangle (corner radius ~2mm) centered on the path endpoint.
steps.detailedText: An oval-ish cross-section is comfortable and strong. Slightly wider than tall helps grip and print quality.

tips: Ensure the profile plane is perpendicular to the path tangent.
Make the profile centered on the path endpoint to avoid twisting.

warnings.text: If the sweep twists, your profile may not be perpendicular or centered.

steps.title: Sweep Handle (Join)
steps.instruction: Create > Sweep. Profile = handle cross-section. Path = handle arc. Operation = Join.
steps.detailedText: Sweep creates the solid handle and merges it to the mug body. Join is required so it becomes one printable piece.

requires.reason: Sweep is a Solid Create tool.

tips: Select profile first, then path.
If join fails, check handle endpoints are touching/overlapping the mug body.

warnings.text: If Sweep fails, reduce profile size or simplify the path curvature.

steps.title: Blend Handle Joints (Stronger + Cleaner)
steps.instruction: Modify > Fillet. Select the edges where handle meets mug body. Start with 3mm, then increase to 5–7mm if it succeeds.
steps.detailedText: Large fillets at the joints reduce stress concentration and make the handle look like it was designed (not glued on).

requires.reason: Fillet is a Solid Modify tool.

tips: Apply fillets in two passes: small first, then larger.
If fillet fails, fillet fewer edges at once.

warnings.text: Big fillets can fail if geometry is tight—work up gradually.

steps.title: Base Protection Fillet
steps.instruction: Modify > Fillet. Select the bottom outer edge. Set radius to ~2mm.
steps.detailedText: A small base fillet reduces chipping and improves the feel when sliding on tables.

requires.reason: Fillet is a Solid Modify tool.

tips: Keep it subtle—too large changes the silhouette.
If the base foot exists, choose the outermost edge that contacts the table.

steps.title: Quality Check (Thickness + Clearance)
steps.instruction: Inspect the mug: verify shell thickness is ~3mm, rim is smooth, and handle clearance fits fingers comfortably.
steps.detailedText: Before exporting/printing, verify the model is manufacturable and ergonomic.

finalChecklist: Handle joins are smooth and strong
